isis.stitle: TSI 91-12-07R - 1991 Model Year Component Identification and Service Parts Listing For DT/DTA-466 Diesel Engines

subjectgroup.subject: 1991 Model Year Component Identification and Service Parts Listing For DT/DTA-466 Diesel Engines

lev1.title: CHANGES FOR 1991 MODEL YEAR DT/DTA-466 DIESEL ENGINES
lev1.para: All DT/DTA-466 diesel engines starting with serial numbers 618500 and above, also 618496 and 618497, have been revised for 1991 model year.
The purpose of this bulletin is to list components which are different between 1990 and 1991 model year engines and to provide a list of new service parts.
Major changes for 1991 model year DT/DTA-466 diesel engines are as follows:

item.para: The single U.S.A. 50 states and Canadian engine emission ratings introduced in 1990 will no longer be used.

"Federal" and "California" emissions rated designated engines will be used starting with the 1991 model year. Canadian applications can use either 1991 Federal or California emission designated engines.
The following engine models are released for 1991 model year Federal and California applications:
NOTE: Eight new "increased" horsepower engines are available for 1991 model year and are indicated in BOLD print .

para.emph: DT-466 (E195C) 195HP@2400 RPM equipped with a Model "MW" Fuel Injection Pump.
DT-466 (E195F) 195HP@2400 RPM equipped with a Model "A" Fuel Injection Pump

item.para: DT-466 (E210C) 210HP@2400 RPM equipped with a Model "MW" Fuel Injection Pump.
DT-466 (E210F) 210HP@2400 RPM equipped with a Model "MW" Fuel Injection Pump.
DT-466 (E220F) 220HP@2400 RPM equipped with a Model "MW" Fuel Injection Pump.
DT-466 (E220C) 220HP@2400 RPM equipped with a Model "MW" Fuel Injection Pump.

para.emph: DTA-466 (E230C) 230HP@2400 RPM equipped with a Model "MW" Fuel Injection Pump.
DTA-466 (E230F) 230HP@2400 RPM equipped with a Model "MW" Fuel Injection Pump.
DTA-466 (E250C) 250HP@2400 RPM equipped with a Model "MW Fuel Injection Pump.
DTA-466 (E250F) 250HP@2400 RPM equipped with a Model "MW" Fuel Injection Pump.
DTA-466 (E250TC) Taylored Torque - Rise 250HP@2400 RPM equipped with a Model "MW" Fuel Injection Pump.
DTA-466 (E250TF) Taylored Torque -Rise 250HP@2400 RPM equipped with a Model "MW" Fuel Injection Pump.

item.para: DTA-466 (E270C) 270HP@2400 RPM equipped with a Model "MW" Fuel Injection Pump.
DTA-466 (E270F) 270HP@2400 RPM equipped with a Model "MW" Fuel Injection Pump.
Changes to the following components are made to reduce emission levels so as to meet current Federal and California regulations:
Fuel Injection Systems: Fuel Injections Pumps and Fuel Injection Nozzles

lev1.para: The following Component Changes Chart ( Table 1) is provided to help to quickly identify major changes in the 1991 model year DT/DTA-466 diesel engines.

entry.para: High Pressure Injecting Piping (for all DT/DTA-466 Diesel Engines equipped with Robert Bosch Model "MW" Fuel Injection Pumps

lev1.title: ENGINE IDENTIFICATION
lev1.para: The 1991 model year DT/DTA-466 diesel engines start with serial numbers 618500 and above, also 618496 and 618497.
The emission label designates the engine model as well as the certified emission standards for the model year.

figure.caption: Figure 1. Engine Serial Number Pad And Emission Label Identification (DT-466 [Model E210F] Equipped With Robert Bosch Model "MW" Fuel Injection Pump And Electric Shut-Off Shown, All Other DT/DTA-466 Diesel Engines Are Similar)

lev2.title: PISTONS
lev2.para: 1991 model year pistons feature the following design changes: Refer to Figure 2.

item.para: Piston bowl geometry ("A" and "B") is decreased for 1991 model year piston to accommodate a higher compression ratio of 16.5:1 vs. 15.2:1 for 1990 model year.
Raised ring groove position ("C") for 1991 model year piston to reduce dead volume and increase bowl volume.
Oil ring groove dimension ("D") is decreased to accommodate raised ring groove position.

note.para: Piston is serviced individually and in various packages. Refer to Parts Informationfor service part numbers of packages.
1990 and 1991 model year pistons are NOT interchangeable and are NOT to be substituted for each other in service.

lev2.title: RINGS
lev2.para: To accommodate 1991 model year pistons having a narrower oil control ring groove, a new oil control ring is released.
The new oil control ring is thinner in width and shorter in height vs. 1990 model year oil control ring. Refer to Figure 3.
All piston rings are "Not Serviced Separately" and can only be obtained by ordering the appropriate service package.
Refer to Parts Information for a listing of affected service packages.

note.para: 1990 and 1991 model year piston oil control rings are NOT interchangeable and are NOT to be substituted for each other in service.

figure.caption: Figure 3. 1990 Versus 1991 Model Year Piston Oil Control Ring Comparison

lev2.title: INJECTION PUMP
lev2.para: 1991 model year engine fuel injection pumps have new calibrations to achieve required exhaust emission.
Calibration data regarding these fuel injection pumps will be released on a separate service bulletin.

note.para: Use only the specified fuel injection pump to achieve certified exhaust emissions for the engine rating. Injection pump identification is made by the International part number located on the name plate at the rear of the governor housing. Refer to Figure 4 and Figure 5.

figure.caption: Figure 4. Model "A" Fuel Injection Pump And Governor Identification (Used Only On DT-466 [Model E195F] Emission Certified Diesel Engines)
Figure 5. Robert Bosch Model "MW" Fuel Injection Pump And Governor Identification (Used On All DT/DTA-466 Diesel Engines Except DT-466 [Model E195F])

table.title: 1991 Engine Rating and Fuel Injection Pump Part Numbers

lev2.title: HIGH PRESSURE INJECTION PIPING
lev2.para:
For all DT/DTA-466 Diesel Engines Equipped with Robert Bosch Model "MW" Fuel Injection Pumps. Refer to
Figure 6.

New high pressure fuel injection pipe assembly, P/N 1 817 230 C91 (consisting of 6 individual injection pipes and clamps) is released for all 1991 model year DT/DTA-466 diesel engines equipped with Robert Bosch Model "MW" Fuel Injection Pump. Refer to Parts Information for part numbers of individual cylinder pipes.
1991 model year injection pipes feature a new bend configuration resulting in improved emissions vs. 1990 model year fuel injection pipe assembly, P/N 1 815 358 C91.

note.para: 1991 model year DT-466 (E195F) is equipped with a Robert Bosch Model "A" Fuel Injection Pump. This engine model is equipped with fuel injection pipe assembly P/N 1 815 351 C91 which is designed for use with the Robert Bosch "A" pump on this 1991 engine model. The fuel injection pipe assembly for this engine model is NOT shown in Figure 6.

figure.caption: Figure 6. Fuel Injection Cylinder Pipe Assembly Comparison (For All DT/DTA-466 Diesel Engines Equipped With Robert Bosch Model "MW" Fuel Injection Pump)

lev2.title: INJECTION NOZZLES
lev2.para: To increase injection pressure, new injection nozzle and holder assemblies are released for all 1991 model year DT/DTA-466 Diesel Engines. Refer to Table 4 for new nozzle and holder assembly part numbers.

All 1991 model year diesel engines except E270C and E270F feature nozzle and holder assemblies having a 5 spray hole nozzle tip versus 1990 model year nozzle and holder assemblies having 4 spray hole nozzle tips.

E270C and E270F diesel engines continue to use nozzle and holder assemblies having 4 spray hole nozzle tips but now feature nozzle tips with a smaller spray hole diameter of .325 mm versus 1990 model year nozzle and holder assemblies having nozzle tips with spray hole diameter of .355 mm.

important.para: Do not intermix injection nozzle assemblies! Intermixing nozzles between engine model years will result in poor performance and non-compliance with emission standards Refer to Figure 7 for nozzle and holder assembly identification.

table.title: 1991 Model Year Nozzle And Holder Assemblies

para.emph: 1991 Model Year Nozzle & Holder Assembly Part Number

figure.caption: Figure 7. 1991 Model Year Nozzle And Holder Identification

lev1.title: COMPONENT CHANGES: CRANKCASE
lev1.para: To improve the seating of roller tappet guides, 1991 model year crankcase assembly, P/N 1 817 371 C91, is released having an added spotface around roller tappet bosses. Refer to Figure 8.

lev1.title: COMPONENT CHANGES: ROLLER TAPPET GUIDES
lev1.para: To accommodate the added spotface around roller tappet bosses on 1991 model year crankcase, new roller tappet guides, P/N 1 813 892 C1, are also released for 1991 model year.
The contour of new guides are designed to fit in spotfaced roller tappet bosses and to prevent guide hang-up in roller tappet bore.
New guides are slightly shorter than 1990 model year guides, P/N 1 811 580 C1 and have larger ears. Refer to Figure 9.

note.para: 1991 and 1990 model year roller tappet guides are NOT interchangeable and should NOT be substituted in service for each other.

lev1.title: COMPONENT CHANGES: TURBOCHARGER
lev1.para: 1991 model year DT/DTA-466 diesel engines feature a newly designed Turbocharger Assembly having a flange added to exhaust outlet of turbine housing side allowing direct hook-up of exhaust pipe. Refer to Figure 10.

figure.caption: Figure 10. 1991 Model Year Turbocharger Assembly Versus 1990 Model Year Turbocharger Assembly

lev1.para: With the addition of new flange, turbo exhaust elbow P/N 683 520 C1, Turbo Sleeve, P/N 675 317 C2 and two Seal Rings, P/N 702 299 C1 are eliminated from 1991 model year engines.
Refer to Table 5for correct 1991 model year turbocharger assembly part numbers and engine model code application.

table.title: 1991 Model Year Turbocharger Assembly Part Number and Engine Model Code Application

para.emph: 1991 Model Year Turbocharger Assy. Part Number

entry.para: E195C & E195F (not for FC bus application
E210C & E210F (not for FC bus application)

lev1.title: COMPONENT CHANGES: CRANKCASE VENTILATION
lev1.para: Starting with 1991 model year the crankcase ventilation system is redesigned and relocated from cylinder head valve cover where it was previously mounted, to the right side of crankcase. Refer to Figure 11.

figure.caption: Figure 11. 1991 Model Year Crankcase Ventilation System

lev1.para: Redesigned ventilation system consists of a new breather housing assembly P/N 1 812 654 C2, breather element P/N 675 494 C2, breather housing gasket P/N 1 810 699 C4, breather baffle P/N 1 810 835 C1 and attaching hardware.

note.para: Crankcase ventilation system is now common between 300 and 400 series engines.

lev1.para: The following new parts are also released to accommodate new crankcase ventilation system:

item.para: A new cylinder head valve cover P/N 676 088 C5, no longer having a breather housing mounting hole.
A new turbo oil drain tube assembly P/N 1 817 209 C1, having a redesigned bend configuration.
